channel.title: Golang on The B0ardside
channel.description: Recent content in Golang on The B0ardside

item.title: Andrew Gerrand talking at Go UK 2015 - stupid gopher tricks
item.description: Hah, some awesome bits in here…

item.title: Rob Pike, Go Concurrency Patterns
item.description: I thought I had seen this, but no, it’s just a similar theme to other talks by Rob Pike I’ve seen - this one is quite fun to code along too, its a super neat and compact concurrency app..

item.title: Rob Pike, Go Routines
item.description: This is a great talk by Rob Pike on Go Routines, Channels and concurrency… Rob Pike - 'Concurrency Is Not Parallelism' from Waza on Vimeo.

item.title: Rob Pike, GopherCon 2014 Keynote
item.description: Awesome, awesome talk from Rob Pike, the keynote for GopherCon 2014, some old Unix/C history and lots of details of Go development –

item.title: Go Presentation
item.description: More and more I’ve been dabbling with Go, which, mainly due to Hacker News, i’ve been reading so many good things about. The syntax is super easy to pick up, but the killer feature seems to be the concurrency primitives - the Go Functions and message passing Channels seem like a super tight, rock solid implementation of Hoare’s Communicating Sequential Processes. The following video is a really succinct walk through of building a concurent multi-protocol chat application ala Chat Roulette.
